oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New Testament found on the Shiloh battlefield
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: New Testament found on the Shiloh battlefield the day after the battle ended. Note the water stains as well as the autograph page. It belonged to 1st Sgt. Martin L. Calhoun of Peoria, Ill., of Co. E., 11th Ill. Vol. Cav. Regt., USA, commanded by Col. Ingersoll. Calhoun, later commisssioned a captain, mustered out of service at Peoria after the war. The book was found by Mr. Younger, a tenant on a farm 13 miles from the battle site. Testimony on this was provided by Mrs. Lee S. Grubbs.
